course.subject: CSC
course.title: Programming Languages and Paradigms
course.catalogDescription: This course explores major programming paradigms (including the functional, object-oriented, and logic programming paradigms) and principles of the design of programming languages. Students will learn to adapt quickly to new programming languages, select appropriate programming languages for projects, compare and contrast languages, and make the best use of features of languages they have learned.

objectives.objective: Compare and contrast procedural, functional, object-oriented, and logic approaches to programming
Write basic algorithms that avoid assigning to mutable state or considering reference equality
Use functional encapsulation mechanisms such as closures and modular interfaces
Use closures and correctly reason about their implications for variable scope
Define and use iterators, generators, and comprehensions and apply fluent interfaces in stream processing
Work with a formal definition of a language to produce an abstract syntax tree
Use various advanced programming constructs and idioms correctly
Discuss how various advanced programming constructs aim to improve program structure, software quality, and programmer productivity
Discuss the role of concepts such as orthogonality and well-chosen defaults in language design
Use a logic language to implement a conventional algorithm
